start.text: I want to understand the enemy.
This should prove to be fun.
I'm testing this ship. You must find your own space.
I see a great deal of promise here.

start_boss.text: There are pilots like you in every generation. And I've felled every last one of them.
Let me test them, to see if they're truly worthy.

retreat.text: Head home. It's not safe to stick around here if we lose our fleet.
Must I continue to gaze upon my failure?

out_of_missiles.text: Missile did not connect. That wasn't the plan.

engaged.text: You're quite the entertainer, but the show's over with this next shot.
He's fast, and decisive, flies like a true veteran.
Next shot will find its mark.
Think you can keep up with me?

need_help.text: Seems like he's trying to draw me in after him, not a bad plan, actually.

pursuing.text: Eject, while you can still talk.

running.text: No, that's not it, that will not do.
Enemy has a lock on me, evading!

hull_90.text: My status is fine. Do not interfere.
My status? Well... I'm feeling a little excited.
It's just like you say, the enemy has experienced fighters in their midst.

hull_50.text: Beyond the limits of machine assistance, I see.
This ship is my body. If it is not enough, I must put my soul into it.

hull_30.text: If they are not enough, I must put my soul into it.
Am I destined to simply wither away, and lose the freedom to fly the open void as I once did?
I never wanted to create anything and now here I am, clinging to life.

death.text: You must find someone to guide you. I am not that person.
This was all due to my ego.
Don't waste your life. Dedicate it to reclaiming that which you call home.
In the end, I was unable to create anything.
I unleashed pure chaos onto this world, just so I could keep my wings.
